meanings.definition: Present and explain (a theory or idea) systematically and in detail.
meanings.sent1: During the presentation, the teacher will expound on the scientific theory.
meanings.sent2: She likes to expound her thoughts clearly during discussions.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to expound the joke, but it only made it more confusing.
meanings.sent4: As the artist painted, he seemed to expound the beauty of nature onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The author's words expound the magical world of his imagination.

meanings.definition: Explain the meaning of (a text or speech).
meanings.sent1: The professor will expound the poem to help us understand it better.
meanings.sent2: Can you expound the main idea of the story for the class?
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to expound the punchline, but it only made the audience more confused.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to expound the sadness hidden behind her smile.
meanings.sent5: The map legend will expound the symbols used for easier navigation.
